commit_message:
Fix IPv6 Neigh Adv issue for router IPs

Presently IPv6 functionality is broken with OVN. When a VM
sends an IPv6 Neighbor Solicitation request for the router IP,
ovn-controller when it responds with Neighbor Adv packet doesn't
set the 'router' bit in the 'flags' field. This results in the
default route getting delted. The fix [1] tried to addressed this
issue. But that fix was not completely tested in the openstack context.
ovn-northd adds Neighbor Adv flows for router IPs both in the logical
switch pipeline and logical router pipeline. The commit [1] addressed
the issue in the logical router pipeline. It should have removed the
IPv6 Neighbor Adv flows from the logical switch pipeline. The patch [2]
has been proposed upstream to remove these flows from the logical
switch pipeline. Until that is fixed in core OVN, this patch addresses
this issue in networking-ovn itself as a temporary fix (with the intention
to backport as patch [2] may not be available for OVS 2.9).

When 'add_router_interface' is called, this patch sets the router ports
peer's Logical_Switch_Port.addresses column to it's mac address instead
of 'router'. If the Logical_Switch_Port.addresses is not set to 'router',
ovn-northd will not add the Neighbor Adv flows in the logical switch
pipeline, there by mitigating this issue.

Once the patch [2] is merged, we can revert these changes.

[1] - https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/c9756229ed818e4c354d8bfd7c65c656f92fc98b#diff-2c35162acf6ad144624954fdc4c3d9f4
[2] - https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/961565/

Closes-bug: #1788684
(cherry picked from commit 91d26e6573d33558b32c1daea40c401ad43ffc7c)

Conflicts:
	networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py
Change-Id: I815ce0996f66f6b101c2151a8389a8b3fbe026f6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-07 01:57:18.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for multiple policy files.

Loading many policy files is necessary to implement the tests for
the policy actions provided by the plugins.

Change-Id: Ib24f3d6d7a5ffdeaecce579af9795fd897dce872
Story: 2002641
'}, {'created': '2018-09-07 16:27:24.000000000', 'message': "Add support for multiple policy files

Most of the neutron plugins provide an updated version of policy.json
file with full list of rules, but at the same time there are a lot of
other plugins which provide their own policy files and store them in
the policy.d/ folder: neutron-fwaas, networking-bgpvpn, vmware-nsx,
ect...
To implement the tests for such plugins the Patrole should be able to
load and merge multiple policy files for any of the services.

Modify the discover_policy_files function to discover all policy files
for each of the services. Using glob.glob() function makes it possible
to use patterns like '*.json' to discover the policy files.
Modify the _get_policy_data function to load a data from all dicoverd
policy files for a service.

Update the unit test according to the changes.

Change-Id: Ib24f3d6d7a5ffdeaecce579af9795fd897dce872

commit_message:
Add support for multiple policy files

Most of the neutron plugins provide an updated version of policy.json
file with full list of rules, but at the same time there are a lot of
other plugins which provide their own policy files and store them in
the policy.d/ folder: neutron-fwaas, networking-bgpvpn, vmware-nsx,
ect...
To implement the tests for such plugins the Patrole should be able to
load and merge multiple policy files for any of the services.

Modify the discover_policy_files function to discover all policy files
for each of the services. Using glob.glob() function makes it possible
to use patterns like '*.json' to discover the policy files.
Modify the _get_policy_data function to load a data from all discovered
policy files for a service.

Update the unit test according to the changes.

Change-Id: Ib24f3d6d7a5ffdeaecce579af9795fd897dce872

commit_message:
Remove galera_client meta-dependency

Given that pymysql is pure python and has no C binding
dependencies, we no longer need the role to install the
MariaDB client libraries.

Change-Id: Ic3717c372ba6fff981c79a1580e658a77d638e18
(cherry picked from commit b54f44e74bc9f6dd050a266320b07648480adcaa)

commit_message:
Listing objects to return Munch objects

list_objects was returning a list of dict objects, being incosistent
with other listing methods in OpenStackCloud. It is now consistent,
returning a list of Munch objects.

Story: #2003568
Task: #24861

Change-Id: I39ca8d6221aa34db1f4ba983d169b7701d0328d8

Looks like bandit doesn't like use of a hash function."}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-09-19 09:56:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-09-19 13:10:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2018-09-19 13:54:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Ah, rebasing on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603629 should get past the Bandit issue. revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-09 15:08:25.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Icffa90f60d885ffc6edf21999d4eb9143ad636a5

commit_message:
Update doc/conf.py to avoid warnings with sphinx 1.8

The autodoc_default_flags option is now deprecated.[1] This warning can
cause documentation build failed. use autodoc_default_options instead.

[1]https://github.com/matplotlib/matplotlib/pull/11928

Change-Id: I6ba69ca7361fd0e42b322f1b92fe22b952a13321

commit_message:
Use templates for cover and lower-constraints

Use openstack-tox-cover template, this runs the cover job as
non-voting in the check queue only.

Use openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template

Remove jobs that are part of the templates.

Reorder templates alphabetically.

Also, add repo to designate queue for co-gating.

Change-Id: I8cd7ec2e27e3e15c92a9f57f98117eca006059b1

subject: Release monasca-events-api and cut stable/rocky
messages:
[{'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-08-10 08:38:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-08-10 09:29:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

That's a new deliverable, so technically it's a bit late to add... I'll wait for the rest of the review team before approving"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-08-10 16:22:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> That's a new deliverable, so technically it's a bit late to add...
 > I'll wait for the rest of the review team before approving

Yes, given that it is so far past the deadline I'm not sure we want to add it to the release. Maybe an independent release this cycle and add it to stein?"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-08-10 16:30:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Adding a -1 just to make it obvious there are some comments here that need to be addressed.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-08-10 16:33:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It really depends how functional the rest of Monasca is without this... If it's needed by the rest of Monasca, or if it's more like a split in existing functionality, I'd be OK with it."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-08-20 18:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Any updates on this Witold?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-08-24 15:12:32.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-1 by Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2018-08-27 07:04:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry, Witek is on vacations now.
Monasca-events-api is not used anywhere for now in stable/rocky so release is not needed for stable/rocky.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-08-29 09:57:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thanks a lot Dobroslaw! We should probably abandon this one then'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-09-05 12:47:49.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Please "restore" this change if you think this decision was a bad idea.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-09-18 14:04:08.000000000', 'content': "Restored

Restoring to discuss how to proceed with it.

We've discussed it during the PTG last week. It's true that it was added late and that the project isn't used anywhere yet, but SUSE plans to add it in their next release. It would be good to have a branch where bugfixes can be backported and CI runs with upper constraints for Rocky.

We could release the next version in Stein and cut `backport/rocky` branch from it.

My preferred solution would be though to make an exception to release process, tag this very first 0.1.0 release in Rocky and cut `stable/rocky` as proposed. It would make CI configuration much easier."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-09-18 14:13:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Restored
 > 
 > Restoring to discuss how to proceed with it.
 > 
 > We've discussed it during the PTG last week. It's true that it was
 > added late and that the project isn't used anywhere yet, but SUSE
 > plans to add it in their next release. It would be good to have a
 > branch where bugfixes can be backported and CI runs with upper
 > constraints for Rocky.
 > 
 > We could release the next version in Stein and cut `backport/rocky`
 > branch from it.
 > 
 > My preferred solution would be though to make an exception to
 > release process, tag this very first 0.1.0 release in Rocky and cut
 > `stable/rocky` as proposed. It would make CI configuration much
 > easier.

We usually handle things that miss the official release deadline by adding them in the _independent directory. You can create the tag and stable/rocky branch there, and the release will show up on releases.o.o but not on the rocky page."}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-09-18 14:47:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-09-18 14:48:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks Doug, released it as independent now.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-09-18 15:09:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

LGTM. I'm going to wait to approve to ensure the validation passes and to give Sean time to review."}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-09-18 15:58:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-09-19 07:20:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Validation has failed for PS2

  deliverables/_independent/monasca-events-api.yaml: 'independent' is not one of ['cycle-with-intermediary', 'cycle-with-milestones', 'cycle-trailing', 'untagged']"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-09-19 12:51:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-09-19 12:54:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Use noninteractive frontend for Debian upgrade

When upgrading packages for Debian based make
sure we set the frontend to noninteractive so
we dont get stopped on questions popping up.

Change-Id: I2dfa77840401261e4c58095b978e1f6374ed69a1

wait for messages

subject: Configure notifications to be unversioned
messages:
[{'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2018-07-27 18:10:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2018-07-30 22:41:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2018-08-07 02:56:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Not really clear why this is failing. It succeeds in my own tests:

DEBUG:runner:2018-08-07 01:33:47,651 config_updated_since DEBUG: File mtime is newer than provided mtime (1533605505.94 >= 1533605415.0) on nova-cloud-controller/0 (OK)
DEBUG:runner:2018-08-07 01:35:34,521 run_action WARNING: charmhelpers.contrib.amulet.utils.run_action has been deprecated for amulet.run_action
DEBUG:runner:2018-08-07 01:36:23,063 run_action WARNING: charmhelpers.contrib.amulet.utils.run_action has been deprecated for amulet.run_action
DEBUG:runner:Exit Code: 0
DEBUG:bundletester.utils:Updating JUJU_MODEL: "billy-olsen:admin/default" -> ""
DEBUG:bundletester.fetchers:git rev-parse HEAD: 178d033f8655612ed4eee20b30d6f630b8ed01af

_____________________________________________________________________________________________________ summary _____________________________________________________________________________________________________
  func27-smoke: commands succeeded
  congratulations :)

Unfortunately, the nova-cloud-controller logs seem to be missing from the UOSCI run itself so I can't do further debug on that part without determining why it didn't collect the ncc logs.

Will trigger another retest to see if its transient/poor timing and dig into how to get the debug data other ways.'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2018-08-07 02:56:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2018-08-15 14:12:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

amulet error looks like for whatever reason the nova api was not running at the time amulet tried to create an instance but looking at the nova and charm logs there are no errors (most probably the charm had restarted the api).'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2018-08-15 14:12:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2018-08-17 15:45:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Ive run the amulet tests locally and reproduced exactly the same behaviour but it is actually just a race condition cause by the nova-api being restarted while the test is querying the api. See https://pastebin.ubuntu.com/p/8xqGWRcnwJ/. Re-running the test results in success so I'm happy to +1 this."}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-08-20 09:25:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2018-09-19 13:43:31.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This has now been released to stable (18.08) so it not needed.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-27 18:10:29.000000000', 'message': 'Configure notifications to be unversioned

Beginning in the Pike release, Nova started sending both versioned
and unversioned notifications. The verioned notification queues do
not have any consumers so this causes some queues to fill up until
either the messages expire or they are flushed. This changes the
nova configuration to only send unversioned (legacy) notifications.

Change-Id: Ibaef9dfd75cf2ce6c20d92746b3cf7b37bac24b9
Related-bug: #1665449
(cherry picked from commit d0c3c808bb70da1c4c9ef6460d513586e1fb5239)
'}]
commit_message:
Configure notifications to be unversioned

Beginning in the Pike release, Nova started sending both versioned
and unversioned notifications. The verioned notification queues do
not have any consumers so this causes some queues to fill up until
either the messages expire or they are flushed. This changes the
nova configuration to only send unversioned (legacy) notifications.

Change-Id: Ibaef9dfd75cf2ce6c20d92746b3cf7b37bac24b9
Related-bug: #1665449
(cherry picked from commit d0c3c808bb70da1c4c9ef6460d513586e1fb5239)

commit_message:
Add python36 jobs to microversion-parse

python35 is pretty old and often not available by default on some
operating systems, so we need to be testing python36.

Copy zuul job settings from project-config

Official projects are doing this as part of enabling python3
first, but it matters more here as a way to manage with local
control.

subject: Remove loadbalancer_id from lbaas pool creation
messages:
[{'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-09-19 11:40:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-09-19 12:42:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

"Either listener_id or loadbalancer_id must be specified." doesn't sound like unexpected behavior could happen. Moreover this [1] snippet tells us that providing only listener_id results in Octavia doing additional operations to get loadbalancer_id from listener_id. And the error message that API call returns is "Must provide at least one of loadbalancer_id, listener_id".

I don't see a lot of point here, but code's correct.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/master/octavia/api/v2/controllers/pool.py#L196-L208'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-09-19 13:12:31.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This is not actually needed. Problem is a race somewhere else'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-19 11:40:41.000000000', 'message': 'Remove loadbalancer_id from lbaas pool creation

According to the Octavia API, either listener_id or loadbalancer_id
must be specified when creating the lbaas pool. Passing both may
lead to unexpected behaviors.

Change-Id: I6d37c31c1023ba651a1ab55d62e5d53202a04acb
'}]
commit_message:
Remove loadbalancer_id from lbaas pool creation

According to the Octavia API, either listener_id or loadbalancer_id
must be specified when creating the lbaas pool. Passing both may
lead to unexpected behaviors.

Change-Id: I6d37c31c1023ba651a1ab55d62e5d53202a04acb

commit_message:
Add a more detailed release note for Dell BOSS RAID1 fix

The fix depends on python-dracclient 1.5.0, so we must clearly indicate
it in the release notes, especially when backporting to stable branches.
This was pointed on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603153/

Change-Id: Id88f03a83cbb9792ca6b691d1fc721a49939d422

Remove galera_client meta-dependency

Given that pymysql is pure python and has no C binding
dependencies, we no longer need the role to install the
MariaDB client libraries.

This looks correct to me. We do try to tag all of the parts of a deliverable at once, so I think if there was a mistake at all it was in allowing the earlier tags to not include all of the repos.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-09-18 15:00:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I took pause with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573642/ since it's adding new config options, but they are disabled by default so it's OK. The mistral-* changes are just zuul CI stuff. As for skipping 6.0.2 and 6.0.3 for the mistral-* packages, I guess that's up to the release team - it seems weird to me, but I'm not sure what the normal convention is and if jumping the gap is OK."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-09-18 15:00:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Fix stein release and cycle-trailing dates

Missed one place where the stein release date was referring to Thursday
and not Wednesday, and incorrectly set cycle-trailing to be two months
instead of three.

Change-Id: I8f4e40cece4aca8f5b49237a0276e35400c4aa94
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-08 15:35:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-08 17:35:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-08 15:35:46.000000000', 'message': "Install plugins for standard services

Provide a list of standard tempest plugins in variables, and
enable some of them by default. The ones enabled by default
are the ones set by default for the rest of the tempest role.

We are using --isolated for now, to ensure the installation
of the package can fetch the packages from anywhere, not
only from the repo server, because the repo server doesn't
build the tempest plugins requirements (we don't list them
in our tempest packages to install, because we find them
at runtime, instead of building them staticly in our code)

Change-Id: I4d504e9c60b6d15fa5a5fdf013c4392a9e895ac0
(cherry picked from commit bf077bc1936432d3677cc67eb28f7b268505dd79)
"}]
commit_message:
Install plugins for standard services

Provide a list of standard tempest plugins in variables, and
enable some of them by default. The ones enabled by default
are the ones set by default for the rest of the tempest role.

We are using --isolated for now, to ensure the installation
of the package can fetch the packages from anywhere, not
only from the repo server, because the repo server doesn't
build the tempest plugins requirements (we don't list them
in our tempest packages to install, because we find them
at runtime, instead of building them staticly in our code)

Change-Id: I4d504e9c60b6d15fa5a5fdf013c4392a9e895ac0
(cherry picked from commit bf077bc1936432d3677cc67eb28f7b268505dd79)

commit_message:
Add aio host conf for barbican role

Adding this example conf file would guide user to set correct host
name in AIO case. An experimental test for barbican has been added
which uses the barbican tempest plugin.

Backport note:
The zuul configuration between queens and master is quite different,
so this patch adapts that configuration to fit into the queens model.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/600952
Change-Id: I10a07d5e4b2b3fbf122a79f15e27a9ca34799221
(cherry picked from commit d65906c48654cfa103d52223a74be200d0b4e0a0)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-18 13:24:07.000000000', 'message': "tasks: lxc_apparmor: Use aa-disable to disable apparmor profiles

Restarting Apparmor on openSUSE does not work as expected[1] and profiles
are not fully reloaded. It's advised to use aa-disable when apparmor is
running in order to properly disable and unload a running profile.

[1] https://bugzilla.opensuse.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1108688

Change-Id: I19ac419e54413e9d2b92051d870d5e6d93a5db3c

commit_message:
tasks: lxc_apparmor: Use aa-disable to disable apparmor profiles

Restarting Apparmor on openSUSE does not work as expected[1] and profiles
are not fully reloaded. It's advised to use aa-disable when apparmor is
running in order to properly disable and unload a running profile.

[1] https://bugzilla.opensuse.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1108688

Change-Id: I19ac419e54413e9d2b92051d870d5e6d93a5db3c

commit_message:
Remove galera_client meta-dependency

Given that pymysql is pure python and has no C binding
dependencies, we no longer need the role to install the
MariaDB client libraries.

Change-Id: I2c42f931498847f5a6fbac96260058f85c477dc5

commit_message:
Remove galera_client meta-dependency

Given that pymysql is pure python and has no C binding
dependencies, we no longer need the role to install the
MariaDB client libraries.

Change-Id: Ib486a09c6e5d202332b9d7700526ab9007524a82

commit_message:
Remove galera_client meta-dependency

Given that pymysql is pure python and has no C binding
dependencies, we no longer need the role to install the
MariaDB client libraries.

Change-Id: I3a6c04807b4bad36c5d9b378db71bd76257ff888

commit_message:
Support secure_boot extra_spec in _format_flavor

This change enables the nova-powervm driver to accept the
'powervm:secure_boot' extra_spec and pass it down to pypowervm to
build the LPAR wrapper with.

Change-Id: I080065795778adee86c6cb37bcbf700a440d73b9

commit_message:
Remove galera_client meta-dependency

Given that pymysql is pure python and has no C binding
dependencies, we no longer need the role to install the
MariaDB client libraries.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/602907
Change-Id: I9a37bd999a02e97205409d956a838f7ee62ed45f

[{'created': '2018-07-27 21:08:43.000000000', 'message': 'Eliminate race conditions in legacy updates

Wait for the stack to move to the IN_PROGRESS state before returning from

Change-Id: Id94d009d69342f311a00ed3859f4ca8ac6b0af09
Story: #1669608
Task: 23175
'}, {'created': '2018-07-31 00:51:34.000000000', 'message': "Eliminate client races in legacy operations

Wait for the legacy stack to move to the IN_PROGRESS state before returning
from the API call in the stack update, suspend, resume, check, and restore
operations.

For the stack delete operation, do the same provided that we can acquire
the stack lock immediately, and thus don't need to wait for existing
operations to be cancelled before we can change the state to IN_PROGRESS.
In other cases there is still a race.

Change-Id: Id94d009d69342f311a00ed3859f4ca8ac6b0af09
Story: #1669608
Task: 23175"}]
commit_message:
Eliminate client races in legacy operations

Wait for the legacy stack to move to the IN_PROGRESS state before returning
from the API call in the stack update, suspend, resume, check, and restore
operations.

For the stack delete operation, do the same provided that we can acquire
the stack lock immediately, and thus don't need to wait for existing
operations to be cancelled before we can change the state to IN_PROGRESS.
In other cases there is still a race.

Change-Id: Id94d009d69342f311a00ed3859f4ca8ac6b0af09
Story: #1669608
Task: 23175

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-13 21:20:59.000000000', 'message': 'Move ara to scripts-library

Deployment jobs may wish to install the ARA callback using the same
methods we use in the gate without using the test-oriented script
gate-check-commit.sh. We can solve this by moving the ARA setup to
a scripts-library function, and then call the function inside
gate-check-commit. This will allow downstream users to source
scripts-library and call the setup_ara function to install ARA
as well.

Change-Id: I789fb68be3f372757a4267e1cd7f8cd3b5cf8101
'}]
commit_message:
Move ara to scripts-library

Deployment jobs may wish to install the ARA callback using the same
methods we use in the gate without using the test-oriented script
gate-check-commit.sh. We can solve this by moving the ARA setup to
a scripts-library function, and then call the function inside
gate-check-commit. This will allow downstream users to source
scripts-library and call the setup_ara function to install ARA
as well.

Change-Id: I789fb68be3f372757a4267e1cd7f8cd3b5cf8101

commit_message:
Reinstate deployment of gnocchi resources file

In https://review.openstack.org/512775 the gnocchi resources
file was removed from deployment along with the gnocchi tox
environment (which was never completed to the state of being
a working test).

This patch completes the removal of the gnocchi test
implementation, but reinstates the deployment of the gnocchi
resource file as its location has changed, but it is still
present in the ceilometer repo.

Change-Id: I7b58d30c527c130f6f7ba9b593953ce4a5ae08a0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-23 20:41:46.000000000', 'message': "DNM Make get_agents wait for sb_cfg to increment

This copies how the Open_vSwitch schema waits for cur_cfg to
increment after updating next_cfg. It should make the get_agents
call increment nb_cfg and wait for sb_cfg to be incremented, that
way we are sure about the 'alive' status.

get_agent should probably also do this, I just want to make sure
all of the thets pass first. Some of could also be better done by
making ovsdbapp handle some of the changes to make them useable
between Open_vSwitch and OVN_Northbound schemas.

Change-Id: Ib08473e4768c94ad3b0a223b72f1dad1d26769dd
"}, {'created': '2018-07-24 14:20:22.000000000', 'message': "DNM Make get_agents wait for sb_cfg to increment

This copies how the Open_vSwitch schema waits for cur_cfg to
increment after updating next_cfg. It should make the get_agents
call increment nb_cfg and wait for sb_cfg to be incremented, that
way we are sure about the 'alive' status.

get_agent should probably also do this, I just want to make sure
all of the thets pass first. Some of could also be better done by
making ovsdbapp handle some of the changes to make them useable
between Open_vSwitch and OVN_Northbound schemas.

Change-Id: Ib08473e4768c94ad3b0a223b72f1dad1d26769dd
"}, {'created': '2018-08-01 14:58:53.000000000', 'message': "Make get_agents wait for sb_cfg to increment

Make agent API get commands increment nb_cfg and wait for the
appropriate chassis nb_cfg values to be incremented before
building the agents dicts to return.

If we need to, we could probably add a check interval in which we
don't do the nb_cfg update for a call to the agent API functions,
but I didn't want to prematurely optimize.

Change-Id: Ib08473e4768c94ad3b0a223b72f1dad1d26769dd
"}, {'created': '2018-08-01 14:59:49.000000000', 'message': "Make get_agents wait for sb_cfg to increment

Change-Id: Ib08473e4768c94ad3b0a223b72f1dad1d26769dd
"}, {'created': '2018-08-01 15:05:23.000000000', 'message': "Make get_agents wait for sb_cfg to increment

appropriate chassis nb_cfg values to be incremented before
building the agents dicts to return.

If we need to, we could probably add a check interval in which we

Change-Id: Ib08473e4768c94ad3b0a223b72f1dad1d26769dd
"}, {'created': '2018-08-01 23:10:26.000000000', 'message': 'DNM Make get_agents wait for sb_cfg to increment

Make agent API get commands increment nb_cfg and wait for the
appropriate chassis nb_cfg values to be incremented before
building the agents dicts to return.

There is a new config option for how long to wait for the
chassis to be updated. The time and nb_cfg value of the
last check is recorded and used to return a cached "alive"
value since waiting 60 seconds for every get_agents call to
return when ovn-controller is down seems excessive. I'm
not happy with this solution, so I'm very open to comments
on it. I have some ideas I may work on tomorrow, but wanted
to put this up to get some feedback.

Change-Id: Ib08473e4768c94ad3b0a223b72f1dad1d26769dd
'}, {'created': '2018-08-06 12:49:57.000000000', 'message': 'DNM Make get_agents wait for sb_cfg to increment

'}, {'created': '2018-09-07 01:06:07.000000000', 'message': "Use neutron's agent_down_time for agent liveness

Instead of returning the immediate status, mimick ML2/OVS's
agent_down_time handling. With this patch, we no longer have an
issue where an agent will appear down because we didn't wait long
enough for ovn-controller to update the Chassis and we don't have
to wait before sending a response to API requests.

Closes-Bug: #1719574
Change-Id: Ib08473e4768c94ad3b0a223b72f1dad1d26769dd
"}, {'created': '2018-09-07 01:08:42.000000000', 'message': "Use neutron's agent_down_time for agent liveness

Instead of returning the immediate status, mimick ML2/OVS's
agent_down_time handling. With this patch, we no longer have an
issue where an agent will appear down because we didn't wait long
enough for ovn-controller to update the Chassis and we don't have
to wait before sending a response to API requests.

Closes-Bug: #1719574

commit_message:
Use neutron's agent_down_time for agent liveness

Instead of returning the immediate status, mimick ML2/OVS's
agent_down_time handling. With this patch, we no longer have an
issue where an agent will appear down because we didn't wait long
enough for ovn-controller to update the Chassis and we don't have
to wait before sending a response to API requests.

Closes-Bug: #1719574
Change-Id: Ib08473e4768c94ad3b0a223b72f1dad1d26769dd

commit_message:
Add xinetd config to make an AIO survive a reboot

The AIO requires the option "galera_monitoring_allowed_source" to
survive a reboot. Without this change an AIO will die when it reboots
due to traffic never originating from the isolated addresses.

Change-Id: I001df9368414c6fc8a4febbb6f2fc01ead5066b4
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add the extra parameter in the tooz dependency

The ceilometer requirement is tooz[zake] and not only tooz:

https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/requirements.txt#L36

if zake is not specified, it does not get installed and the dependency gets lost

Change-Id: Ie80704a1ed6750adb39d6a6fa5a61a0ccd7b4ebd
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>

subject: Disable vxlan_networking check for upgrades jobs.
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-19 06:38:42.000000000', 'message': 'Disable vxlan_networking check for upgrades jobs.

Currently, this check is failing in all
mixed_upgrades jobs, as the respositories
are not being set up in the subnode-1 due
to different releases being deployed in
the undercloud and overcloud. This causes
having an old ovs version installed in the
subnode that makes the vxlan_networking
script fail.

Change-Id: Ic2f51a4fbc2bfde219c0527d93771b013ace54d9
Closes-Bug: #1791115
'}]
commit_message:
Disable vxlan_networking check for upgrades jobs.

Currently, this check is failing in all
mixed_upgrades jobs, as the respositories
are not being set up in the subnode-1 due
to different releases being deployed in
the undercloud and overcloud. This causes
having an old ovs version installed in the
subnode that makes the vxlan_networking
script fail.

Change-Id: Ic2f51a4fbc2bfde219c0527d93771b013ace54d9
Closes-Bug: #1791115

commit_message:
Add support for configured NAT source variable

In some clouds there are more than one potential NAT source and shade's
auto_ip can't figure it out propery. os-client-config added a config
option similar to nat_destination called nat_source to help people set a
config in such environments. Add support for it.

This is a port of I4b50c2323a487b5ce90f9d38a48be249cfb739c5 by Monty
Taylor from shade to openstacksdk.

Change-Id: Ie2d01168a24172f37ebf32f754d8e1a52149cb6e
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

[{'created': '2018-09-14 16:11:18.000000000', 'message': "Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it. The associated
   scripts are also removed.
2. We consolidate test-vars.yml and the overrides into a single
   file to conform to the standard in other roles and ensure
   that the overrides are only set in one place.

Change-Id: I2dcb1576a75c4d09c6d99e1369775301e99df770
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it. The associated
   scripts are also removed.
2. We consolidate test-vars.yml and the overrides into a single
   file to conform to the standard in other roles and ensure
   that the overrides are only set in one place.

Change-Id: I2dcb1576a75c4d09c6d99e1369775301e99df770

[{'created': '2018-09-17 09:54:04.000000000', 'message': 'Lower disk space requirement for undercloud

In CI we test undercloud reinstall too, which means the undercloud
content is already on the machine taking up space when the validations
are called. The install passes but the re-install fails. To be able to
test re-install we should lower the requirement to 20G, which matches
the pre-upgrade requirement.

Change-Id: I67a67e13079567241412ef4eb23d34491ec4d1db
Partial-Bug: #1792560
(cherry-picked from commit 5f9c302d856373a60cbae7fc89b492f2b3e9b005)
'}]
commit_message:
Lower disk space requirement for undercloud

In CI we test undercloud reinstall too, which means the undercloud
content is already on the machine taking up space when the validations
are called. The install passes but the re-install fails. To be able to
test re-install we should lower the requirement to 20G, which matches
the pre-upgrade requirement.

Change-Id: I67a67e13079567241412ef4eb23d34491ec4d1db
Partial-Bug: #1792560
(cherry-picked from commit 5f9c302d856373a60cbae7fc89b492f2b3e9b005)

subject: Ensure ceilometer repo gets installed with neutron
messages: [{'account_id': 21883, 'date': '2018-09-18 14:09:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-19 05:20:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-09-19 06:43:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-18 14:09:44.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure ceilometer repo gets installed with neutron

Until the ceilometer dependency in n-odl is "optionalize", we need
ceilometer to be part of the n-odl deployment:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603068/

To avoid the integrated build to fail, we must adjust
ceilometer_git_project_group to all so that it builds the wheels for
neutron_all too

Change-Id: I4ba101610549f28e444400693f3751a7aee3b9af
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure ceilometer repo gets installed with neutron

Until the ceilometer dependency in n-odl is "optionalize", we need
ceilometer to be part of the n-odl deployment:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603068/

To avoid the integrated build to fail, we must adjust
ceilometer_git_project_group to all so that it builds the wheels for
neutron_all too

Change-Id: I4ba101610549f28e444400693f3751a7aee3b9af
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>

commit_message:
Remove fedora-atomic diskimage-builder element

Since Fedora Atomic 27+ works out of the box, this diskimage-builder
element is no longer necessary to build custom images.

Story: 2002532
Task: 22078

commit_message:
Revert "Add lxc3 compatibility"

This reverts commit 440c87a808c0cec2e2f10b6758596c2754b7dfe0.

The commit is reverted because it uses a lookup to resolve the version
of lxc. This is executed on the deploy host and not the targets. The
Depends-On is a patch to the lxc_container_create role which addresses
the differences between lxc2/3 configuration keys dynamically and
resolves the installed lxc version on a per-target basis.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/601534
Change-Id: Id3669777ad50f9e90a08212daa8d9e252b01089b

commit_message:
Deploy Sahara with unversioned endpoints

Sahara supports unversioned endpoint also for the stable API v1.1,
and this is a requirement in order to use the experimental API v2.
See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582285/ for more details.

Following the pattern used for other services with unversioned
endpoints, the sahara_service_*uri variables are directly and all
sahara_service_*url can thus be removed.

Closes-Bug: #1782147
Change-Id: I2d4477de6a3ad58fe58152b18e18a9a6dffdafd4

commit_message:
Close session after updating lease statuses

If the session is left open, later migration scripts may hang when
trying to access the same tables.

Change-Id: I8745c38f44b6b9eefaa5dfd30815cd57a3c668e9

[{'created': '2018-09-18 13:30:48.000000000', 'message': 'Revisit conflicting package removal

In https://review.openstack.org/534819 we introduced the removal
of conflicting packages from the targeted host, but then we deleted
the list for RedHat in https://review.openstack.org/578844 because
yum kept removing and re-adding the same packages.

In https://review.openstack.org/603205 we solve the issue properly
given that yum is case-insensitive, and the root cause of the repeat
remove/install.

As such, in this patch, we restore the removal of conflicting
packages for RedHat in a different way. Each of the package removal
tasks are moved into the tasks specific to each package manager so
that each can be handled differently.

(cherry picked from commit 72f402d3e969c94754ade02953d2c94ce541b25e)

commit_message:
Revisit conflicting package removal

In https://review.openstack.org/534819 we introduced the removal
of conflicting packages from the targeted host, but then we deleted
the list for RedHat in https://review.openstack.org/578844 because
yum kept removing and re-adding the same packages.

In https://review.openstack.org/603205 we solve the issue properly
given that yum is case-insensitive, and the root cause of the repeat
remove/install.

As such, in this patch, we restore the removal of conflicting
packages for RedHat in a different way. Each of the package removal
tasks are moved into the tasks specific to each package manager so
that each can be handled differently.

Change-Id: I70fbfa6eff8796713c6bec32319382273f8281f8
Related-Bug: #1762421
Related-Bug: #1742206
(cherry picked from commit 72f402d3e969c94754ade02953d2c94ce541b25e)

commit_message:
Revisit conflicting package removal

In https://review.openstack.org/534819 we introduced the removal
of conflicting packages from the targeted host, but then we deleted
the list for RedHat in https://review.openstack.org/578844 because
yum kept removing and re-adding the same packages.

In https://review.openstack.org/603205 we solve the issue properly
given that yum is case-insensitive, and the root cause of the repeat
remove/install.

As such, in this patch, we restore the removal of conflicting
packages for RedHat in a different way. Each of the package removal
tasks are moved into the tasks specific to each package manager so
that each can be handled differently.

Change-Id: I70fbfa6eff8796713c6bec32319382273f8281f8
Related-Bug: #1762421
Related-Bug: #1742206
(cherry picked from commit 72f402d3e969c94754ade02953d2c94ce541b25e)

This change allows the role to accept either lxc2 or lxc3 config
keys, plus a list of key substitutions to make when writing the

This allows a set of config keys to remain defined as variables

Change-Id: Ifc871a9fcaf77ff36cfcc1c87b1f406862d46d22

commit_message:
Convert lxc2 to lxc3 config keys dynamically

This change allows the role to accept either lxc2 or lxc3 config
keys, plus a list of key substitutions to make when writing the
lxc config file.

This allows a set of config keys to remain defined as variables
outside this role and generate a valid config on both lxc2 and lxc3
based hosts.

Change-Id: Ifc871a9fcaf77ff36cfcc1c87b1f406862d46d22
(cherry picked from commit 959a56eb6b9aa522e00c24ecd1b1861d8eec3107)

commit_message:
Create blazar-devstack-dsvm job for stable/pike

The blazar-devstack-dsvm job was moved to in-repo configuration during
the Queens cycle. This patch creates it for the stable/pike branch as it
is being removed from openstack-infra/project-config. The python35
variant is not added as stable/pike doesn't support Python 3.

Change-Id: I2c5421a9e969bfe3129e0ab415226546397d79a8

commit_message:
Remove old nova-compute / mysql relation and patch for nova-lxd bug

This review is modified to include a patch to resolve bug #1793137
which is due to a bug in nova-lxd where the wrong pool name (lxd) is
used with zfs if lxd is new enough that the storage.zfs_pool_name key
is missing from the config.  This is the case on bionic and snap
installed lxd.

Closes-Bug: #1713807
Related-Bug: #1793137
Change-Id: I1123d9882bdb00e9183424b363fc3d1ff25f2346

Long time ago it was required because ironicclient defaulted to
an ancient version. It was changed back in Queens (ironicclient 2.0),
so we can drop it now to avoid confusion.

Change-Id: Icea0bdf6d5dcdd81ce9c34be7af8a241da0861bc
Closes-Bug: #1789392
(cherry picked from commit 97298707451df065351ce002b8875830afc9d008)

commit_message:
Stop hardcoding baremetal API version in stackrc

Long time ago it was required because ironicclient defaulted to
an ancient version. It was changed back in Queens (ironicclient 2.0),
so we can drop it now to avoid confusion.

Change-Id: Icea0bdf6d5dcdd81ce9c34be7af8a241da0861bc
Closes-Bug: #1789392
(cherry picked from commit 97298707451df065351ce002b8875830afc9d008)

commit_message:
heat-api fix log path

As it can be check on the gate[1], the log path for the service
is not set properly. "/var/log/containers/heat/heat-api.log"

This patch set the path properly to:
  "/var/log/containers/heat/heat_api.log.txt"

[1]  http://logs.openstack.org/36/594836/1/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario002-multinode-oooq-container/427de6c/logs/subnode-2/var/log/config-data/fluentd/etc/fluentd/config.d/100-openstack-heat_api.conf.txt.gz

commit_message:
Enable fluentd on scenario002-multinode-containers

As there are several log path that are not set properly to be used by fluentd.
Fluentd needs to be enabled on the scenarios to be able to check the path properly.

This patch only enables fluentd on scenario002-multinode-containers.

Change-Id: If253da4f0f89221dc6ddacc280c984079c6a3c7f

commit_message:
Remove references to logging_group

This has been unused for a while, and even deprecation was scheduled
(although the patch never merged [1]). So, in order to stop folks
getting confused with this, it's being removed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543871/

Change-Id: Icc6b51044ccc826f5b629eb1abd3342813ed84c0

commit_message:
Use the correct branch for tempest tests

The tempest tests at the time were in the trove repo, so to
ensure we're matching the right tests with the service, we
pin to the same branch.

Change-Id: I23f7c12c9195b5115079c1281a49dd67ace2a2f3

commit_message:
Remove External network from DVR related configuration

DVR doesn't imply the "External" networks, simply some type of
connection that is being used for floating IP traffic. This patch
removes the External network from the DVR role and "left overs" from
environment files. It also corrects the multiple-nics version of the
templates so that the ComputeDVR role is attached to the external
bridge with no IP.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Sneddon <dsneddon@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ia599e01dbefe4e4c752b7d4c1c7e5682963101f7

    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I6272f6bad5cd3a7f0792b5befe2509d1edcf2c0f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-15 15:28:26.000000000', 'message': "Make openstack-service-setup compatible with openstack-ansible

This change allows this particular playbook to be run using
openstack-ansible, which implicitly uses the openstack-ansible inventory
where the utility_all[0] container is actually defined. I don't
understand how this playbook would work in the
multi-node-aio/playbooks/site.yml context where it is presumably
normally run. The only example I know of disables it:
https://github.com/rcbops/rpc-openstack/blob/67fc071c0b4c7e4b58eda4eaed317ed87820fb57/gating/check/run_deploy_mnaio.sh#L60

Change-Id: I8b2a0217e851d022ee40cbdd8bc8045e18d5a07d
"}, {'created': '2018-09-17 17:01:32.000000000', 'message': "Make openstack-service-setup compatible with older ansible

This change allows this playbook to be run using an older version of
ansible. This change is necessary for my use case where I am running all
OSA and related playbooks in a docker container locally for a Newton
deploy.

The use of Newton OSA's ansible bootstrap script means that the
openstack-ansible my workflow uses requires Ansible 2.1, which does not
support `include_tasks`. This change addresses that problem by replacing
`include_tasks` in the playbook that needs to be run using
openstack-ansible with `include` which produces the desired result.

Change-Id: I8b2a0217e851d022ee40cbdd8bc8045e18d5a07d
"}]
commit_message:
Make openstack-service-setup compatible with older ansible

This change allows this playbook to be run using an older version of
ansible. This change is necessary for my use case where I am running all
OSA and related playbooks in a docker container locally for a Newton
deploy.

The use of Newton OSA's ansible bootstrap script means that the
openstack-ansible my workflow uses requires Ansible 2.1, which does not
support `include_tasks`. This change addresses that problem by replacing
`include_tasks` in the playbook that needs to be run using
openstack-ansible with `include` which produces the desired result.

Change-Id: I8b2a0217e851d022ee40cbdd8bc8045e18d5a07d

commit_message:
[WIP] Allow requesting additional subnets via annotation

This commit enables vif-handler to request VIFs from multiple networks.
This is currently done via Pod annotation, that contains subnet ids.

Signed-off-by: Danil Golov <d.golov@partner.samsung.com>

[{'created': '2018-09-07 16:46:33.000000000', 'message': 'Disable vxlan_networking in mixed_upgrade RDO cloud jobs.

Jobs running in OpenStack infra load by default
a common.yaml file which disables the vxlan_networking,
but this is missing for the RDO cloud jobs. Which
impacts mostly in the mixed version job, like upgrades,
as the overcloud repos are not configured as part of
the undercloud installation.

commit_message:
Disable vxlan_networking in mixed_upgrade RDO cloud jobs.

Jobs running in OpenStack infra load by default
a common.yaml file [0] which disables the vxlan_networking,
but this is missing for the RDO cloud jobs. Which
impacts mostly in the mixed version job, like upgrades,
as the overcloud repos are not configured as part of
the undercloud installation.

[0] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582885/
Change-Id: I5c72292d84b916d5e4b19de800ad544c4d56e6d1
Closes-Bug: #1791115

commit_message:
Adding support for py35 by disabling swift

This patch adds support for inspection in python3 environment
by rolling out configuration of swift in inspector.

Depends-On: Id0eb971caf1790289cbf3869e16d0d153b600379
Change-Id: I7cd19238098f9734b493c1ae26a5c2c1a34907d4

commit_message:
Wait for cinder volume to be deleted

If users delete a container with auto-removed cinder volume(s),
it should wait for the cinder volumes to be removed in cinder side
before completing the container deletion process.

Change-Id: I38dc6766b167f66c0e3327d883fdeb5a79bef2ed

commit_message:
Fix help message for subnetpool default-quota value

Default pre-project quota is the number of IP addresses that can be
allocated from the subnet pool. For example, with a quota of 128,
I might get a 64 addresses subnet1, and 16 addresses subnet2,
and still have room to allocate 48 more addresses in the future.

Change-Id: Ia0ba827790b190647aed990e47347560fc9e9f0c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 16:16:33.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I09bb55e842515307fbedeee6ba6519dfa4b95e24
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I09bb55e842515307fbedeee6ba6519dfa4b95e24

the logic for waiting volume to become 'available' is specific

commit_message:
Refactor code for waiting volume available

There are multiple volume driver in Zun (i.e. cinder, local) and
the logic for waiting volume to become 'available' is specific
to cinder. This patch refactors the code to move cinder specific
logic to cinder volume driver.

Change-Id: Id8bb22e2c26d1603a4030017bd158ee4e8e885af

subject: Restart scheduler in TestNovaManagePlacementHealAllocations
messages: [{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-08-30 12:59:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2018-09-13 20:56:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-09-18 14:36:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-30 12:59:43.000000000', 'message': "Restart scheduler in TestNovaManagePlacementHealAllocations

TestNovaManagePlacementHealAllocations tests rely on the
CachingScheduler specifically because it does not use
placement and therefore does not create allocations during
scheduling, which gives us instances that need to heal
allocations.

However, we have a race in the test setup where the scheduler
is started before the compute services. The CachingScheduler
runs a periodic task on startup to fetch the hosts from the
DB to initialize it's cache, and then uses that during scheduling
until the periodic runs again. So what we can hit is the
scheduler starts, loads an empty cache, then we start the computes
and try to create an instance but because of the empty cache we
fail with a NoValidHost error.

This restarts and resets the CachingScheduler cache *after* we have
started the computes and asserted they are available in the API.

Change-Id: I32f607a436e9851a96877123ae3d1fe51f444f73
Closes-Bug: #1781648
(cherry picked from commit 4fe4fbe7a43ac7e971b0aabc8a9079c7701cae55)
"}]
commit_message:
Restart scheduler in TestNovaManagePlacementHealAllocations

TestNovaManagePlacementHealAllocations tests rely on the
CachingScheduler specifically because it does not use
placement and therefore does not create allocations during
scheduling, which gives us instances that need to heal
allocations.

However, we have a race in the test setup where the scheduler
is started before the compute services. The CachingScheduler
runs a periodic task on startup to fetch the hosts from the
DB to initialize it's cache, and then uses that during scheduling
until the periodic runs again. So what we can hit is the
scheduler starts, loads an empty cache, then we start the computes
and try to create an instance but because of the empty cache we
fail with a NoValidHost error.

This restarts and resets the CachingScheduler cache *after* we have
started the computes and asserted they are available in the API.

Change-Id: I32f607a436e9851a96877123ae3d1fe51f444f73
Closes-Bug: #1781648
(cherry picked from commit 4fe4fbe7a43ac7e971b0aabc8a9079c7701cae55)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-18 17:10:10.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid using loop_var in endpoint manage

When the OSA connection plugin is used on older ansible versions,
and when haproxy runs in a container, a bug exists where the loop_var
fails to properly delegate the task to the haproxy container.

We can avoid using loop_var in the delegation of the task by simply
moving the loop_var up one level so that the endpoint-manage task
file can use {{ item }}.

This was introduced in the commit:
https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/a8a809839484105d9cd27463defc19a8a617c64b#diff-db999e390dd84f2a8c2a48b19aa9533f

Fixes-Bug: #1790779
Change-Id: I17dafb283e41ce05083ae4adb3a325aaca0253dd
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid using loop_var in endpoint manage

When the OSA connection plugin is used on older ansible versions,
and when haproxy runs in a container, a bug exists where the loop_var
fails to properly delegate the task to the haproxy container.

We can avoid using loop_var in the delegation of the task by simply
moving the loop_var up one level so that the endpoint-manage task
file can use {{ item }}.

This was introduced in the commit:
https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/a8a809839484105d9cd27463defc19a8a617c64b#diff-db999e390dd84f2a8c2a48b19aa9533f

Fixes-Bug: #1790779
Change-Id: I17dafb283e41ce05083ae4adb3a325aaca0253dd

commit_message:
Bump os_neutron to remove SELinux support

SELinux support was entirely broken even when it's set to permissive
because we don't do any gating tests with SELinux on but set on
permissive.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/596572
Change-Id: Id93e3bc9e1f75e55e36264589bb18a5ff4dfffb7

During a transition from Queens to Rocky, services will fail
without an endpoint listening on port 35357. Rather than
remove the haproxy endpoint, we implement a front-end which
will point at the new back-end. Once the keystone role runs
this will no longer be used, but it does no harm to be there.

Closes-Bug: #1790158
Related-Review: https://review.openstack.org/602763
Change-Id: I5affdc30597ab296e88c8d2b4793aefd26c495b1
'}]
commit_message:
Implement haproxy frontend for old keystone admin backend

During a transition from Queens to Rocky, services will fail
without an endpoint listening on port 35357. Rather than
remove the haproxy endpoint, we implement a front-end which
will point at the new back-end. Once the keystone role runs
this will no longer be used, but it does no harm to be there.

Closes-Bug: #1790158
Related-Review: https://review.openstack.org/602763
Change-Id: I5affdc30597ab296e88c8d2b4793aefd26c495b1

commit_message:
Run zun-api with 'root' user

It looks zun-api needs root permission to run under apache2.
Otherwise, the zun process will have problem to write to
apache2 logs.

Change-Id: I8b201fc70b8347be9869d7e6bf1eec00d8a32d6e

the repository. This change makes sure that this is the case just as
we already do in `bootstrap-ansible.sh`.

[{'created': '2017-11-16 19:32:54.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I9c702cf31729107e76c1cbd9365ea15bcb423273
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I9c702cf31729107e76c1cbd9365ea15bcb423273

commit_message:
Elasticsearch: Add ingress, remove node ports

This adds an ingress to the Elasticsearch chart, allowing for the
exposure of the Elasticsearch cluster externally if required.

This also removes the node ports from the data and discovery
services, as these ports should not be used beyond service
discovery by the elasticsearch nodes. It moves the node port for
the client service under the network.elasticsearch key to match
the network tree for the other services

Change-Id: Ia989eff87b8c9f112c697ae309bbb971dc699aa5

commit_message:
Delete allocations for instances that is not in this node

When migrating a VM, task failed because rabbitMQ exception after the
resource was allocated. In this case, the resource allocated in
placement can not be cleaned.

Change-Id: Ia17a613342e8e2da0e046798ac2aabfb4ddfe64f
Closes-Bug: #1790569

commit_message:
Merge extended_status extension response into server view builder

As nova extensions has been deprecated already and goal is to
merge all scattered code into main controller side.
Currently schema and request/response extended code are there
among all extensions.

This commit merge the extended_status extension resposne into server
view builder.

Partially implements: blueprint api-extensions-merge-stein

Change-Id: I35b933a9fa4ab263f5302463a0f3a5b96a99f855

[{'created': '2018-09-19 02:12:19.000000000', 'message': 'Use mktemp instead of tempfile in gate_hook.sh

The gate_hook.sh file uses `tempfile`, which does not exist in Fedora
28.  In Ubuntu it is marked as deprecated in favor of `mktemp`, which
does exist in Fedora 28.  Since we would like to add a set of tests
running on Fedora 28 it makes sense to replace references to `tempfile`

Change-Id: Ideb344c4e412736927ac8868e9065725803ab895
'}]
commit_message:
Use mktemp instead of tempfile in gate_hook.sh

The gate_hook.sh file uses `tempfile`, which does not exist in Fedora
28.  In Ubuntu it is marked as deprecated in favor of `mktemp`, which
does exist in Fedora 28.  Since we would like to add a set of tests
running on Fedora 28 it makes sense to replace references to `tempfile`
with `mktemp`.

Change-Id: Ideb344c4e412736927ac8868e9065725803ab895

commit_message:
Merge security groups extension response into server view builder

As nova extensions has been deprecated already and goal is to
merge all scattered code into main controller side.
Currently schema and request/response extended code are there
among all extensions.

This commit merge the security groups extension resposne into server
view builder.

Partially implements: blueprint api-extensions-merge-stein

Change-Id: I57141fc6b1ee87ad3933edd9dc255294d03b5651

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

To fix building docs, remove tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Ibf6d312c99cd8d9e572636b068a65d1613e506d6
Story: #2002586
Task: #24321

commit_message:
DNM: Reduce glance timeout to triage bootstrap job

This reduces the wait time for the glance chart deployment, with
the aim of gathering logs from the glance bootstrap job before
kubernetes deletes the pod after the configured number of failures

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603229/

Change-Id: Icf5331351a35d9ec749ee15e4df5e5a05b05d94c

commit_message:
Gate triage: Temporarily disable all checks except for NFS

This temporarily disables all checks and gate jobs except for the
linter and the NFS jobs until we can determine a root cause for
the glance bootstrap job issue, with the goal of reducing the load
on openstack-infra by disabling the heavier failing checks

Change-Id: Icea58a88d8287b6acb3d23749c9681e035b25dcf

commit_message:
policy-in-code support in neutron-lib

policy-in-code will be supported by the main neutron repo
because the neutron API layer uses the policy code in the neutron repo.
However, neutron_lib.context refers to its own policy enforcer,
so we need a small code to support policy-in-code in neutron-lib side.

Part of blueprint get-policy-from-neutron-lib
Change-Id: I4923a069f4080dc53a8fb359f5a1518de06feb2f

subject: Enhance undercloud reboot procedure for baremetal
messages: [{'account_id': 21537, 'date': '2018-09-18 12:22:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-09-18 12:25:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-09-18 17:15:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-09-18 17:15:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-18 12:22:08.000000000', 'message': "Enhance undercloud reboot procedure for baremetal

Rebooting bm undercloud takes longer than vm so procedure has
to be adjusted.

Current mechanism of asserting if system is up is not reliable.
This patch changes it to call wait_for module in do..untill loop:
 try to connect to server to get 'OpenSSH' string with a 30 seconds
timeout, retrying this for 21 time. This results in
 30x21 = 630 sec for whole operation. This might look too high
but better to wait 10 minutes rather than fail job due to slow hw.

Change-Id: Ic463acc7bed84d23033d2b8c00336f1024fe0e3b
(cherry picked from commit 493446caa5cf2c1435e4000a2a859b1684a71d80)
"}]
commit_message:
Enhance undercloud reboot procedure for baremetal

Rebooting bm undercloud takes longer than vm so procedure has
to be adjusted.

Current mechanism of asserting if system is up is not reliable.
This patch changes it to call wait_for module in do..untill loop:
 try to connect to server to get 'OpenSSH' string with a 30 seconds
timeout, retrying this for 21 time. This results in
 30x21 = 630 sec for whole operation. This might look too high
but better to wait 10 minutes rather than fail job due to slow hw.

Change-Id: Ic463acc7bed84d23033d2b8c00336f1024fe0e3b
(cherry picked from commit 493446caa5cf2c1435e4000a2a859b1684a71d80)

import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-06 20:08:32.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I9ee34642c700d1e6ba9c2f3891b7fa1f7f7e1e1d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I9ee34642c700d1e6ba9c2f3891b7fa1f7f7e1e1d
Depends-On: I8989fd4798e80eae27408017e1543819a68b4ab1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
Signed-off-by: Marcin Piwowarczyk <m.piwowarczy@samsung.com>
Co-Authored-By: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
OVH BHS1 Maintenance 2018-09-19 0700 UTC

OVH is performing cloud upgrades which requires API outages.
For BHS1: The maintenance period is 2018-09-19 starting at 0700UTC and
ending at 1200UTC. This changes sets max servers to 0 so that we do not
notice this maintenance on our end.

Change-Id: I954c95593562f125042abdffefc91f04f6e5eb75

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I00255c6943456cf01e616d4f7ed3586fd1c83f86
Story: #2002586
Task: #24314

commit_message:
Remove python-keystoneclient package install

Now that we no longer use our own keystone module, but
instead make use of the ansible runtime venv's shade
library and upstream ansible modules, we can eliminate
this package/library being installed on the host.

To do this, we also ensure that the functional test
now uses the Ansible runtime venv for all OpenStack
modules, and we use the native Ansible OpenStack
modules instead of our own.

Change-Id: I0ecb55308a846ad0f1bb05c10b9e0aad3da15449

But that's mainly refactors, layout of ansible and enhancements as we extend the code to cover more upgrade and more / different multinode and upgrade tests.

Thiago has even gone and created an etherpad to track.

In any case, extensions, improvements and refactors can all be follow ups. Nice work Thiago."}]

This new test job adds multinode testing to swift.
It currently configures 5 nodes: test-runner, proxy,
account, container and object. It starts by checkout out
the latest release and then 'upgrades' the storage nodes
to the current patch under test. That means that it will
the test-runner and the proxy are still running the latest
release.

Future work would include a new set of tests where it will
add objects to the cluster prior to upgrading and then try
to read those objects after the upgrade. It should also be
noted that the 'upgrade' currently only means a new
'git checkout' the configuration files are not being updated.
A future patch should fix that too.

commit_message:
add multinode functional test to swift

This new test job adds multinode testing to swift.
It currently configures 5 nodes: test-runner, proxy,
account, container and object. It starts by checkout out
the latest release and then 'upgrades' the storage nodes
to the current patch under test. That means that it will
the test-runner and the proxy are still running the latest
release.

Future work would include a new set of tests where it will
add objects to the cluster prior to upgrading and then try
to read those objects after the upgrade. It should also be
noted that the 'upgrade' currently only means a new
'git checkout' the configuration files are not being updated.
A future patch should fix that too.

Change-Id: If8e09a082fc024257a98cf332de9a36a18d2adc5

commit_message:
Revert "libvirt: add method to configure migration speed"

This reverts commit 23446a9552b5be3b040278646149a0f481d0a005.

With change Ibf2b5eeafd962e93ae4ab6290015d58c33024132 there
is nothing using the migrate_configure_max_speed method any
longer and can be removed. An additional mock, added after
the change being reverted, is also removed.

Change-Id: I90d6e14bf9383bf71d65d2180474ba228db2feab
Related-Bug: #1786346

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000

Now that the v2.0 API has been removed, with Keystone v3
the admin (35357) and public (5000) ports are the same
and use the same keystone code paths for authentication.

This patch set replace 35357 and only uses port 5000

Change-Id: I1bc6f11892b7ec883210f0d9065a5b7d8f5cc246
(cherry picked from commit 91edbed231b10041512b024a80c0af657155f2b9)

commit_message:
Tune-up logrotate config

The log rotate configuration was leaving too many logs in place and
allowing them to grow too large. This tunes up the logrotation process
to ensure we're retaining information but not excessively.

Change-Id: If0f02352ee2c274f4c589b05630d28126ceba2ab
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Presently the node role assignment is only automatic. Auto selection
makes the assumption every node is identical however in many deployments

optimizing resources and improving general performance. This change

commit_message:
Add capability to set node role

Presently the node role assignment is only automatic. Auto selection
makes the assumption every node is identical however in many deployments
a deployer may want to assign node roles to specific hardware thereby
optimizing resources and improving general performance. This change
adds and documents the ability to set the node roles within an ansible
inventory.

Change-Id: I22a2b636cb1441f17e575439b55ca64f9c7b0336
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Switch to simple service test instead of tempest

It appears that ceilometer itself has no tests now that there
is no API, so we switch to simply verifying if the services
are up.

Distro installs for xenial are not working, which is not
surprising given that the service is using queens packages.
We therefore disable the test for follow up in another patch.

Change-Id: Ia06438c22430c3432f6dff523c22ec3cd7bdddf8

subject: RedHat: Remove packages with conflict with MariaDB
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-18 13:12:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-09-18 13:24:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-09-18 21:32:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-18 13:12:40.000000000', 'message': "RedHat: Remove packages with conflict with MariaDB

In https://review.openstack.org/603056 we tried to remove conflicting
packages from the target host before installing packages from MariaDB,
but that didn't work because the package specified didn't exist. The
name used was an attempt to remove a specific version of the package
to avoid yum always removing and reinstalling the same packages.

Unfortunately yum is case-insensitive, and CentOS/EPEL/RDO have
mariadb-* packages, while the MariaDB repo has MariaDB-* packages.
These packages conflict.

To work around yum's case insensitivity, we have to query for any
installed packages using rpm (which is case-sensitive) and remove them.

We have to remove them without dependencies, otherwise for distro
package installation types on shared hosts it removes far too many
packages.

Combined backport of:

commit_message:
RedHat: Remove packages with conflict with MariaDB

In https://review.openstack.org/603056 we tried to remove conflicting
packages from the target host before installing packages from MariaDB,
but that didn't work because the package specified didn't exist. The
name used was an attempt to remove a specific version of the package
to avoid yum always removing and reinstalling the same packages.

Unfortunately yum is case-insensitive, and CentOS/EPEL/RDO have
mariadb-* packages, while the MariaDB repo has MariaDB-* packages.
These packages conflict.

To work around yum's case insensitivity, we have to query for any
installed packages using rpm (which is case-sensitive) and remove them.

We have to remove them without dependencies, otherwise for distro
package installation types on shared hosts it removes far too many
packages.

Combined backport of:
https://review.openstack.org/603056
https://review.openstack.org/603205

Change-Id: Ide19d3c1b8b0f1e6aed2ea01f2f082e6a2cbb83a
(cherry picked from commit d1d4bf4ac76847f8ba418f863c6cd6c40b63ea72)

commit_message:
Remove mysql-python

The mysql-python package is no longer maintained. We are using
pymysql instead, so this package does not need to be installed.

The Ansible tasks to do work on the MySQL database are all
delegated to the galera containers, so we don't need any of
the dev libraries on the service hosts either.

With this, we also switch django to use pymysql and ensure that
the appropriate distribution package is installed when doing
distro builds.

Change-Id: I020678e0beb131836e3006e46eec22c02977f8ec
(cherry picked from commit 53e79276c9ccffa35b6c4df021677f241a96dc82)

commit_message:
Correct repo_id_map for hdp 2.5

When hdp2.5 cluster installation is done with off-line
repo,hdp-utils repo name should be HDP-UTILS-1.1.0.21.
However this is hardcoded wrongly in sahara repo_id_map
as HDP-UTILS-1.1.0.20.As a result Ambari HDP repo set up
fails.
This fix will correct the repo_id_map

Change-Id: Ibf7d341cc2d2a53be521039d4f843cdbc5ee880b
Story: #2003654
Task: #26067
(cherry picked from commit c59780a955872dfb96bd726d888dcc109b74f340)

Moving featureset_common "multinode-featureset-common.yml" to job config complicates the logic to add "--extra-vars @{{ featureset_common }}" so I think PS20 simplifies this just overriding vars when environment_type == ovb.
