revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-07 12:29:44.000000000', 'message': 'Move toci BASH variables to ansible

This is include the following reviews from [1]:
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585714
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/587340
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/587360
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/587344

Contains the following changes:

DRY_RUN, STATS_* and COLLECT_CONF vars:

	The dry_run ansible var will not be defined by default,
	only manually defined at reproducer and similar.

	The STATS_ vars will be re-implemented after TOCI refactoring

featureset related:

	It does the following move to ansible:
	- FEATURESET_FILE -> common.yaml:job_featureset_file
	- FEATURESET_CONF -> {{ environment_type }}.yaml:featurest_conf

	Also add additional ansible variables:
	- multinode_featureset_file: to point to tq featureset-multinode-common.yaml
	- tripleo_quickstart_dir: to point to tq dir at tripleo_root
	- common_featureset_conf to have the --extra-vars for the featurset_file

Replace toci ENV_VARS by ansible env_vars:

	This move the ENV_VARS to the different
	environment_type yaml config files.

	It also implements there the check if it's running in RDO,
	to add the extra config for it.

	Also note that RHCLOUD env variable has being removed,
	and harcoded the use with "rdocloud".

Move nodes_file and nodes_args to common.yaml:

	As part of [1] task, we do the following move
	from toci bash environment variables:
	- NODES_FILE -> common.yaml:nodes_file
	- NODES_ARGS -> common.yaml:nodes_args

[1] https://trello.com/c/AerVRkBH/887-replace-bash-environment-variables-in-tociquickstartsh-with-ansible-variables-from-zuul-inventory-or-zuul-job-config-s17

Change-Id: I786ef968953e2bff34939c15c16a01f10130d2aa
'}, {'created': '2018-08-07 13:18:58.000000000', 'message': 'Move toci BASH variables to ansible

This is include the following reviews from [1]:
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585714
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/587340
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/587360
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/587344

Contains the following changes:

DRY_RUN, STATS_* and COLLECT_CONF vars:

	The dry_run ansible var will not be defined by default,
	only manually defined at reproducer and similar.

	The STATS_ vars will be re-implemented after TOCI refactoring

featureset related:

	It does the following move to ansible:
	- FEATURESET_FILE -> common.yaml:job_featureset_file
	- FEATURESET_CONF -> {{ environment_type }}.yaml:featurest_conf

	Also add additional ansible variables:
	- multinode_featureset_file: to point to tq featureset-multinode-common.yaml
	- tripleo_quickstart_dir: to point to tq dir at tripleo_root
	- common_featureset_conf to have the --extra-vars for the featurset_file

Replace toci ENV_VARS by ansible env_vars:

	This move the ENV_VARS to the different
	environment_type yaml config files.

	It also implements there the check if it's running in RDO,

	- FEATURESET_FILE -> common.yaml:job_featureset_file
	- FEATURESET_CONF -> {{ environment_type }}.yaml:featurest_conf

	- multinode_featureset_file: to point to tq featureset-multinode-common.yaml
	- tripleo_quickstart_dir: to point to tq dir at tripleo_root
	- common_featureset_conf to have the --extra-vars for the featurset_file

Contains the following changes:

DRY_RUN, STATS_* and COLLECT_CONF vars:

	The dryrun ansible var will not be defined by default,
	only manually defined at reproducer and similar.

        - PLAYBOOK_DRY_RUN -> <job config>:dryrun

	The STATS_ vars will be re-implemented after TOCI refactoring

featureset related:

	It does the following move to ansible:
	- FEATURESET_FILE -> common.yaml:job_featureset_file
	- FEATURESET_CONF -> common.yaml:featureset_conf (job_featureset_file +
                                         featureset-multinode-common.yml)
                          -> ovb.yaml:featureset_conf (job_featureset_file)
                                      overrides common.yaml

	Also add additional ansible variables:
	- multinode_featureset_file: to point to tq featureset-multinode-common.yaml
	- tripleo_quickstart_dir: to point to tq dir at tripleo_root
	- common_featureset_conf to have the --extra-vars for the featurset_file

	This move the ENV_VARS to the different
	environment_type yaml config files.

	It also implements there the check if it's running in RDO,
	to add the extra config for it.

	Also note that RHCLOUD env variable has being removed,
	and harcoded the use with "rdocloud".

Move nodes_file and nodes_args to common.yaml:

	As part of [1] task, we do the following move
	from toci bash environment variables:
	- NODES_FILE -> integrated to common.yaml:nodes_args
	- NODES_ARGS -> common.yaml:nodes_args

- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/587340
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/587360
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/587344

Contains the following changes:

DRY_RUN, STATS_* and COLLECT_CONF vars:

	The dryrun ansible var will not be defined by default,
	only manually defined at reproducer and similar.

        - PLAYBOOK_DRY_RUN -> <job config>:dryrun

	The STATS_ vars will be re-implemented after TOCI refactoring

featureset related:

	It does the following move to ansible:
	- FEATURESET_FILE -> common.yaml:job_featureset_file
	- FEATURESET_CONF -> common.yaml:featureset_conf (job_featureset_file +
                                         featureset-multinode-common.yml)
                          -> ovb.yaml:featureset_conf (job_featureset_file)
                                      overrides common.yaml

	Also add additional ansible variables:
	- multinode_featureset_file: to point to tq featureset-multinode-common.yaml
	- tripleo_quickstart_dir: to point to tq dir at tripleo_root
	- common_featureset_conf to have the --extra-vars for the featurset_file

Replace toci ENV_VARS by ansible env_vars:

	This move the ENV_VARS to the different
	environment_type yaml config files.

	It also implements there the check if it's running in RDO,
	to add the extra config for it.

	Also note that RHCLOUD env variable has being removed,
	and harcoded the use with "rdocloud".

Move nodes_file and nodes_args to common.yaml:

	As part of [1] task, we do the following move
	from toci bash environment variables:
	- NODES_FILE -> common.yaml:nodes_file
	- NODES_ARGS -> common.yaml:nodes_args

        NODES_FILE exported for the reproducer (will be addressed in a
        separate change)

[1] https://trello.com/c/AerVRkBH/887-replace-bash-environment-variables-in-tociquickstartsh-with-ansible-variables-from-zuul-inventory-or-zuul-job-config-s17

Change-Id: I786ef968953e2bff34939c15c16a01f10130d2aa

commit_message:
Move toci BASH variables to ansible

This review contains the following changes and references work from [1]:

DRY_RUN, STATS_* and COLLECT_CONF vars:

	The dryrun ansible var will not be defined by default,
	only manually defined at reproducer and similar.

        - PLAYBOOK_DRY_RUN -> <job config>:dryrun

	The STATS_ vars will be re-implemented after TOCI refactoring

featureset related:

	It does the following move to ansible:
	- FEATURESET_FILE -> common.yaml:job_featureset_file
	- FEATURESET_CONF -> common.yaml:featureset_conf (job_featureset_file +
                                         featureset-multinode-common.yml)
                          -> ovb.yaml:featureset_conf (job_featureset_file)
                                      overrides common.yaml

	Also add additional ansible variables:
	- multinode_featureset_file: to point to tq featureset-multinode-common.yaml
	- tripleo_quickstart_dir: to point to tq dir at tripleo_root
	- common_featureset_conf to have the --extra-vars for the featurset_file

Replace toci ENV_VARS by ansible env_vars:

	This move the ENV_VARS to the different
	environment_type yaml config files.

	It also implements there the check if it's running in RDO,
	to add the extra config for it.

	Also note that RHCLOUD env variable has being removed,
	and harcoded the use with "rdocloud".

Move nodes_file and nodes_args to common.yaml:

	As part of [1] task, we do the following move
	from toci bash environment variables:
	- NODES_FILE -> common.yaml:nodes_file
	- NODES_ARGS -> common.yaml:nodes_args

        NODES_FILE exported for the reproducer (will be addressed in a
        separate change)

[1] https://trello.com/c/AerVRkBH/887-replace-bash-environment-variables-in-tociquickstartsh-with-ansible-variables-from-zuul-inventory-or-zuul-job-config-s17

Change-Id: I786ef968953e2bff34939c15c16a01f10130d2aa

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ia1be797eda38958ddb4d496699494986405d31ca
Story: #2002586
Task: #24341

[{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-07-27 20:15:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-07-27 20:15:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

This should wait for stein'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-07-30 13:43:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-07-30 18:26:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-08-07 20:47:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2018-08-21 19:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2018-08-31 23:58:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-09-04 16:41:01.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-2 by Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-09-04 21:00:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-09-05 12:11:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

For migration from NTP -> PTP during an update/upgrade, NTP service need to be mapped to a new service (to disable ntp on the hosts), PTP service will be enabled freshly. How does this work when we have single service mapping?'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-09-05 23:00:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

So it depends. Since NTP runs uncontainerized, for the upgrade we could just set NTP to OS::Heat::None and have PTP or Chrony have the steps to remove NTP.  Alternatively we can come up with a disable/ntp.yaml that does it and automatically included it when we enable PTP/Chrony. This is the first step to make a generic service that will handle the time sync.  I think my preference would be to have a host_prep task in PTP/Chrony that ensures ntp is stoppped rather than adding the additional complexity that writing a custom disabled/ntp.yaml would entail.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-09-06 02:49:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-09-06 04:27:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

Thanks for the explanation, host_prep_tasks on PTP/Chrony looks viable and much simpler to handle.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-09-18 15:42:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-27 20:15:06.000000000', 'message': "Create a Timesync service declaration

In order to support switching between multiple timesync backends, let's
simplify the service configurations for the roles so that there is a
single timesync service.  This timesync service should point to the
expected backend (ntp/ptp/chrony).

Change-Id: I986d39398b6143f6c11be29200a4ce364575e402
Related-Blueprint: tripleo-chrony

commit_message:
Create a Timesync service declaration

In order to support switching between multiple timesync backends, let's
simplify the service configurations for the roles so that there is a
single timesync service.  This timesync service should point to the
expected backend (ntp/ptp/chrony).

Change-Id: I986d39398b6143f6c11be29200a4ce364575e402
Related-Blueprint: tripleo-chrony

commit_message:
Convert lxc2 to lxc3 config keys dynamically

This change allows the role to accept either lxc2 or lxc3 config
keys, plus a list of key substitutions to make when writing the
lxc config file.

This allows a set of config keys to remain defined as variables
outside this role and generate a valid config on both lxc2 and lxc3
based hosts.

Change-Id: Ifc871a9fcaf77ff36cfcc1c87b1f406862d46d22

commit_message:
Cleanup .zuul.yaml

Some cleanups:
* Use tox-lower-constraints template instead of individual jobs.
* Use cover template to run cover job only in check as voting.
* Sort list of templates alphabetically.
* Remove publish-to-pypi, it should stay in project-config (and
  the project-config change keeps it there).

Change-Id: I228b74e264db7a0f604b6d8b72b60d2c4ee854c5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-17 14:02:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix soft deleting vm fails after "nova resize" vm

Problem description:
When trying to soft-delete an instance that is just resized but the resize
action is not yet confirmed, the soft-delete call will first attempt to
confirm_resize the instance, then an error will occur since confirm_resize
method does not expect a SOFT_DELETING task_state currently.
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/8e052c7/nova/compute/manager.py#L3911

Fix steps:
1 Add SOFT_DELETING to the expected_task_state of confirm_resize method.
2 Since confirm_resize method sets instance.task_state to None, set
  instance.task_state to back to SOFT_DELETING after confirm_resize is
  executed, so the rest workflow should finish as normal situations.

Co-Authored-By: Chen <dstbtgagt@foxmail.com>

Change-Id: Ia4592adc93960625148ffa6e9f7d1cfa0c6046aa
Closes-Bug: #1712480
(cherry picked from commit 018522f4d0566bf9f22fe0264eaedffa12f245e9)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix soft deleting vm fails after "nova resize" vm

Problem description:
When trying to soft-delete an instance that is just resized but the resize
action is not yet confirmed, the soft-delete call will first attempt to
confirm_resize the instance, then an error will occur since confirm_resize
method does not expect a SOFT_DELETING task_state currently.
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/8e052c7/nova/compute/manager.py#L3911

Fix steps:
1 Add SOFT_DELETING to the expected_task_state of confirm_resize method.
2 Since confirm_resize method sets instance.task_state to None, set
  instance.task_state to back to SOFT_DELETING after confirm_resize is
  executed, so the rest workflow should finish as normal situations.

Co-Authored-By: Chen <dstbtgagt@foxmail.com>

Change-Id: Ia4592adc93960625148ffa6e9f7d1cfa0c6046aa
Closes-Bug: #1712480
(cherry picked from commit 018522f4d0566bf9f22fe0264eaedffa12f245e9)

commit_message:
Remove mysql-python

The mysql-python package is no longer maintained. We are using
pymysql instead, so this package does not need to be installed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/602927
Change-Id: I194cea7b270702206b7c3661523804e351798e81

commit_message:
playbooks: healthcheck-infrastructure: Ensure netcat is installed

The netcat package is required to perform the HAProxy tests so make
sure it is installed.

Change-Id: Ic2202164c224db6f24674f294a203f08165823fe

commit_message:
Te-broker: save all nodes console to html log dir

THis change gathers all nodes console and put them into a html log
directory, divided by node name. They can be retrieved by the job with a
curl so they are gathered with the job log itself.

Change-Id: I8ac885eb61dd633238bcdb4c9bc11de8974d37f6

import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:

There are several different scenarios in this blueprint and maybe it could be simplified to take the different cases

1. Change of owner_id
2. Change of tenant_id
3. Change of name

The case 1. is fairly straightforward (I think). This would be useful where owners are given specific rights.

Case 2. gets complex (although it is a clear need from an operations perspective). Issues include Glance and Neutron (image may not be available in new tenant, may need a different IP allocated). Quota comes into play too (maybe new project has no quota). Updating the DB is one step but risks leaving things very inconsistent for the future.

Case 3. is an interesting scenario but I think it is covered by the nova rename command.'}, {'account_id': 8574, 'date': '2015-01-22 10:46:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 8574, 'date': '2015-01-22 10:46:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-01-22 10:49:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-nova-specs-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/67/105367/12/check/gate-nova-specs-docs/218e51d//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 07s
- gate-nova-specs-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/67/105367/12/check/gate-nova-specs-python27/7d15238/ : SUCCESS in 2m 13s'}, {'account_id': 8574, 'date': '2015-01-22 11:01:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

@Tim, thanks for your input!

I am attempting to rewrite the use case now. I feel we will only have 2 use case, which are changing instance owner and changing instance tenant.

Changing tenant should be a little complex, since we need to at least check if Glance image is visible in the destination tenant, and also need to check the quota as you mentioned. For networks and volumes, now my prefer to detach them before we change instance tenant id. Assuming that we have a naked instance, which does not have relationship with Neutron or Cinder, we may be able to handle this case in a simpler way. Network connectivity and storage volume can be handled separately in Neutron and Cinder workflow. Do you think that is a right way?'}, {'account_id': 136, 'date': '2015-01-22 18:56:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Sounds like a good way to go for the moment, i.e. the instance transfer would not be permitted if there are any possible inconsistencies with other services (such as volume or network attached).

The quota handling should be possible to check up front as you propose.

This would be a very useful feature since we often get people accidentally creating VMs in the wrong projects when they have several.

When transferring, an approach like the cinder transfer-create/transfer-accept seems reasonable.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2015-01-29 00:29:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

This was re-opened far to late to make kilo I am afraid, please re-submit for L

This seems like it might have a large impact around things like server groups, nova volumes, neutron networks, etc. It would be good to make sure all those projects are able to transfer ownership of "things" before we try and attempt this in Nova. Maybe thats already true?'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2015-01-29 00:32:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(2 comments)

I like the idea of fixing this, but I think we need to get supporting APIs added to neutron and cinder to support this, first.'}, {'account_id': 8574, 'date': '2015-01-31 18:57:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

(2 comments)

Reply John's comments."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2015-05-04 02:24:12.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Please update this spec for Liberty if you're still interested in pursuing it."}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2015-06-22 20:28:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(6 comments)

Is anyone planning to revive this for Liberty?'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2015-10-01 20:27:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

There was a duplicate spec for the same idea here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/85806/

Sounds like operators still want this but it'd have to be re-proposed for mitaka and it is probably a cross-project impact spec so likely belongs in oslo-specs."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2015-12-02 19:40:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

This came up in the 12/2 operators meeting as a thing that operators want to see available in openstack, but it would have to be a cross-project spec and it'd have to be proposed for N at the earliest."}, {'account_id': 8574, 'date': '2015-12-30 03:24:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Since David Geng does not work on OpenStack any longer, I am not able to restore this code review by myself. Will open a new review for this spec.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2015-12-31 15:41:03.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

Qin Zhao, feel free to update this as needed.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-12-31 15:49:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Verified-1

Build failed (check pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing

It doesn't appear that anyone is working on this. As noted before, I think this is probably a cross-project spec for the openstack-specs repo to start since it's going to involve transfer of ownership of other resources besides just what nova manages."}]

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: If2b0ccc4c5544bbd2d88c4bcbfa0a7960c0e1a43
Story: #2002586
Task: #24321

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-07 18:29:51.000000000', 'message': 'WIP libvirt: Add workaround to stop use of qemu-img by the RT

Change-Id: Ic5c41493dcdcd807209be2beaae0dbbdf5d2ba3f
Closes-bug: #1785827
'}, {'created': '2018-08-07 19:27:13.000000000', 'message': 'WIP libvirt: Add workaround to stop use of qemu-img by the RT

Change-Id: Ic5c41493dcdcd807209be2beaae0dbbdf5d2ba3f
Closes-bug: #1785827
'}, {'created': '2018-08-08 09:21:39.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Add workaround to stop use of qemu-img by the RT

Previously in large deployments the use of qemu-img to inspect the
allocated and virtual size of disks can result in the resource tracker
taking considerably longer to update, blocking other operations such as
live-migration.

This change introduces a simple workaround that reverts to the old
inaccurate but faster behaviour of using ``os.path.getsize`` to
determine these sizes. Operators should only use this workaround if they
are not using the DiskFilter or CachingScheduler, both of which still
rely on these resource tracker values.

Closes-bug: #1785827
Change-Id: Ic5c41493dcdcd807209be2beaae0dbbdf5d2ba3f
'}, {'created': '2018-08-09 12:47:33.000000000', 'message': 'WIP libvirt: rewrite _get_instance_disk_info_from_config

Closes-bug: #1785827
Change-Id: Ic5c41493dcdcd807209be2beaae0dbbdf5d2ba3f
'}, {'created': '2018-08-09 14:01:09.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Use os.stat and os.path.getsize for RAW disk inspection

At present when inspecting a file based image we always use ``qemu-img`` to
determine the virtual size of the image. This works well but can lead to
the resource tracker taking considerable time to update on hosts with
a large number of instances/images.

This change switches to using os.stat and os.path.getsize to determine
the allocated and virtual disk sizes of RAW disks.

Future changes will look into caching the virtual size of the disk
within disk.info locally on the host to also improve this for qcow2 and
ploop, further simplifying this code path.

Closes-bug: #1785827
Change-Id: Ic5c41493dcdcd807209be2beaae0dbbdf5d2ba3f
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Use os.stat and os.path.getsize for RAW disk inspection

At present when inspecting a file based image we always use ``qemu-img`` to
determine the virtual size of the image. This works well but can lead to
the resource tracker taking considerable time to update on hosts with
a large number of instances/images.

This change switches to using os.stat and os.path.getsize to determine
the allocated and virtual disk sizes of RAW disks.

Future changes will look into caching the virtual size of the disk
within disk.info locally on the host to also improve this for qcow2 and
ploop, further simplifying this code path.

Closes-bug: #1785827
Change-Id: Ic5c41493dcdcd807209be2beaae0dbbdf5d2ba3f

commit_message:
Add functional test for live migrate with anti-affinity group

This adds a functional test for an old bug 1600251 which
has already been fixed indirectly via change
I434af8e4ad991ac114dd67d66797a562d16bafe2. That change
updated the request_spec.instance_group.members
via the current state of the instance group in the db when
the live migrate task calls setup_instance_group(). This test
shows the bug is fixed so we can close it out.

Change-Id: Ie07b419732e0832a9b9d16565f6c9d00ba85d654
Related-Bug: #1600251

commit_message:
Switch containerized undercloud job to nv

Unfortunately tripleo-common wasn't properly being tested in this job so
we've managed to break the job. We'll need to switch it to non-voting so
we can land the patch for now.

Change-Id: I042f2046ef951a274915bf4c29d869386b0267ea
Related-Bug: #1792892

commit_message:
Remove the CoprHD driver

The CoprHD driver was marked unsupported
in Rocky and the vendor has indicated that
the driver is deprecated.  Given the feedback
I am removing the driver.

Change-Id: I978315402edeb0c5dd6aee28315973fa502b0e20
(cherry picked from commit 285fbc6447a2557257c2c5a6b3a54d7c3e2235c2)

Change-Id: I1eb212c502ecee6bf42f4aa32086e5ce0b78fae9

commit_message:
[7/7] Add lock_path in neutron.conf

The neutron agents need lock_paths configured. Otherwise, we get
this error:

  RequiredOptError: value required for option lock_path in group [DEFAULT]

Change-Id: I1eb212c502ecee6bf42f4aa32086e5ce0b78fae9

subject: [6/7] Ignore exit status for nova-status upgrade check
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-11 09:29:29.000000000', 'message': '[6/7] Ignore exit status for nova-status upgrade check

Starting with OpenStack Rocky, "nova-status upgrade check" returns an
apparently erroneous warning like this:

  Check: Resource Providers
  Result: Warning
  Details: There are no compute resource providers in the Placement
    service but there are 1 compute nodes in the deployment.
    This means no compute nodes are reporting into the
    Placement service and need to be upgraded and/or fixed.
    See
    https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/placement.html
    for more details.

With this changeset, an exit status of 1 coming from this command is no
longer treated as a reason for stopping with an error.

The ability of the training cluster to allocate resources and launch
VMs is not affected by this.

Change-Id: Ifb88cc3fe66314bfbf7962fda9911da884b0b1bc
'}]
commit_message:
[6/7] Ignore exit status for nova-status upgrade check

Starting with OpenStack Rocky, "nova-status upgrade check" returns an
apparently erroneous warning like this:

  Check: Resource Providers
  Result: Warning
  Details: There are no compute resource providers in the Placement
    service but there are 1 compute nodes in the deployment.
    This means no compute nodes are reporting into the
    Placement service and need to be upgraded and/or fixed.
    See
    https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/placement.html
    for more details.

With this changeset, an exit status of 1 coming from this command is no
longer treated as a reason for stopping with an error.

The ability of the training cluster to allocate resources and launch
VMs is not affected by this.

Change-Id: Ifb88cc3fe66314bfbf7962fda9911da884b0b1bc

subject: [4/7] Remove code for removing old kernel
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-11 09:29:29.000000000', 'message': '[4/7] Remove code for removing old kernel

After updating the kernel, Bionic does no longer allow the removal of
the running kernel the way Xenial did.

This changeset deletes the removal code. We keep the old kernel, which
results in a slightly larger basedisk.

Change-Id: I48117238ac852ad86e6a15cd3d46578243ac3d3c
'}]
commit_message:
[4/7] Remove code for removing old kernel

After updating the kernel, Bionic does no longer allow the removal of
the running kernel the way Xenial did.

This changeset deletes the removal code. We keep the old kernel, which
results in a slightly larger basedisk.

Change-Id: I48117238ac852ad86e6a15cd3d46578243ac3d3c

subject: [3/7] setup_heat_controller: remove upstart-style overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-11 09:29:29.000000000', 'message': '[3/7] setup_heat_controller: remove upstart-style overrides

In Bionic, upstart-style overrides that allowed us to keep services from
starting when the package was installed do no longer work.

On the upside, they do no longer seem necessary. Restarting the heat
services with the changed configuration file takes only a few seconds
now.

Change-Id: I284d6242b3f3ec9566e7a85b74bb5b9b66d1a649
'}]
commit_message:
[3/7] setup_heat_controller: remove upstart-style overrides

In Bionic, upstart-style overrides that allowed us to keep services from
starting when the package was installed do no longer work.

On the upside, they do no longer seem necessary. Restarting the heat
services with the changed configuration file takes only a few seconds
now.

Change-Id: I284d6242b3f3ec9566e7a85b74bb5b9b66d1a649

Change-Id: I40393ef5882c6798b2240dd70e7c6675ac29ad43
'}]
commit_message:
[2/7] Install old-style network configuration tools

Bionic uses netplan/networkd by default, but we are not ready to
switch.

Change-Id: I40393ef5882c6798b2240dd70e7c6675ac29ad43

subject: [1/7] Add/enable Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (Bionic Beaver), OpenStack Rocky
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-11 09:29:29.000000000', 'message': '[1/7] Add/enable Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (Bionic Beaver), OpenStack Rocky

Bionic comes with OpenStack Queens in the default repo and OpenStack
Rocky in the Ubuntu Cloud Archive. Because we are always using UCA,
we need to switch to Rocky now.

This is the first changeset in a series to make Rocky work on Bionic.

Change-Id: If78f9071c5234d8528e5119b2d33e3335d269751
'}]
commit_message:
[1/7] Add/enable Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (Bionic Beaver), OpenStack Rocky

Bionic comes with OpenStack Queens in the default repo and OpenStack
Rocky in the Ubuntu Cloud Archive. Because we are always using UCA,
we need to switch to Rocky now.

This is the first changeset in a series to make Rocky work on Bionic.

Change-Id: If78f9071c5234d8528e5119b2d33e3335d269751

commit_message:
Support installing PyPI packages via a mirror

Add the ability to specify a list of users for whom a PyPI mirror should
be configured for commands such as `pip`.  This is accomplished by
installing a couple of configuration files in each user's home directory.

Change-Id: I21304b32c0c686c8dde2e3e1c0d2e2cd07af1eef
Story: 2003315

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I25b0c5f53d8d68e110515936a7a574b6f417c298
Story: #2002586
Task: #24321

Fix python-netaddr requirement

In some distros there is only python2-netaddr is available,
for example see F28 bug:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1519325

commit_message:
Consolidate cloud/base.py into functional/base.py

This was left as a TODO in the merge of Shade into SDK.

Shade's BaseFunctionalTestCase is now BaseFunctionalTest;
KeystoneBaseFunctionalTestCase is now KeystoneBaseFunctionalTest.

Change-Id: I3b3055eb8e55b9696ac628a88bdee460d6cc0918

commit_message:
Bootstrap ansible virtualenv with --never-download

To prevent virtualenv trying to download the latest pip/setuptools
when creating the venv, and failing due to pip.conf during an upgrade,
we tell it not to do that and rather just use whatever it already has.

Closes-Bug: #1790158

commit_message:
fix: Include missing method in flask ResourceBase class

The patch set https://review.openstack.org/#/c/591147/ changed
the groups API to flask native dispatching. That change included
implementing _normalize_domain_id [0] which calls
``cls._get_domain_id_from_token()`` -- which isn't implemented
anywhere resulting in a 500 internal server error getting raised
[1]. This patch set implements the missing method.

Unit tests have been added to test _normalize_domain_id --
with domain_id, without domain_id (defaults to default domain in
CONF) and without domain_id and is_admin: True (ValidationError).

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/591147/11/keystone/server/flask/common.py@938
[1] http://logs.openstack.org/57/600257/7/check/patrole-admin/ea8c8d8/controller/logs/screen-keystone.txt.gz?level=ERROR#_Sep_15_04_26_35_127915

Change-Id: Ia645f06bde71b14dc41fdf248ce3dadb22b6af60
Closes-Bug: #1792913
Partial-Bug: #1776504

[{'created': '2018-07-19 23:34:09.000000000', 'message': 'Default redis_master_password in connection_string

Ansible 1.6.x breaks the short-circuit that allowed this to work when
redis was not configured / enabled.

Now, keystone.json will trigger a rendering of
osprofiler_backend_connection_string which triggers a rendering of
redis_connection_string which looks for redis_master_password which may
not be present if you have an existing passwords.yaml for your
deployment.

Change-Id: Iab0b3686dbf0bd8f808f6f5f13b7683d8f5ab48b

redis_connection_string which looks for redis_master_password which may
not be present if you have an existing passwords.yaml for your
deployment. This is true even if enabled_osprofiler is false AND
redis_backend is set to elasticsearch...

Change-Id: Iab0b3686dbf0bd8f808f6f5f13b7683d8f5ab48b
'}]
commit_message:
Default redis_master_password in connection_string

Currently, keystone.json will trigger a rendering of
osprofiler_backend_connection_string which triggers a rendering of
redis_connection_string which looks for redis_master_password which may
not be present if you have an existing passwords.yaml for your
deployment. This is true even if enabled_osprofiler is false AND
redis_backend is set to elasticsearch...

Change-Id: Iab0b3686dbf0bd8f808f6f5f13b7683d8f5ab48b

[{'created': '2018-09-11 11:21:38.000000000', 'message': "Force GDPR compliance of containers logs

After purge_after_days, defaults to a 14, forcibly remove
any rotated and compressed logs of containerized services
in /var/log/containers. This overrides any related
containerized logrotate configuration used for
containerized services.

Allow to alter rotation interval for log files managed
via containerized logrotate. Defaults to 'daily'
and rotate 14 (days).

Use sharedscripts to clean up files in the postrotate
script only once.

Additionally, to enforce GDPR compliance of log files
in /var/log/containers, put them under logrotate management
(minsize 1) and always compress. Prohibit the size option
as it does not honor time-based contstraints required by
GDPR. Forcibly remove all files but those rotated and
compressed logs, via the postscript section.

Partial-bug: #1771543

Change-Id: Id8e4717a5ecda53bc9cd39f1c2efaa80b56bd45e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Force GDPR compliance of containers logs

After purge_after_days, defaults to a 14, forcibly remove
any rotated and compressed logs of containerized services
in /var/log/containers. This overrides any related
containerized logrotate configuration used for
containerized services.

Allow to alter rotation interval for log files managed
via containerized logrotate. Defaults to 'daily'
and rotate 14 (days).

Use sharedscripts to clean up files in the postrotate
script only once.

Additionally, to enforce GDPR compliance of log files
in /var/log/containers, put them under logrotate management
(minsize 1) and always compress. Prohibit the size option
as it does not honor time-based contstraints required by
GDPR. Forcibly remove all files but those rotated and
compressed logs, via the postscript section.

Partial-bug: #1771543

Change-Id: Id8e4717a5ecda53bc9cd39f1c2efaa80b56bd45e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit e13654504adb93f7313942b4d839577d3ccd072d)

commit_message:
Expose nova.conf config lines to be used as hiera overrides

Included nova::config in undercloud puppet-stack-config
puppet manifest so that nova configuration parameters can
be overriden using hiera overrides.

Change-Id: I71bc5ed35cc41139481ceb51216183e6c703cf01
(cherry picked from commit b012ddaddc43df12fa598d840e674af989601455)

commit_message:
Set OVS local ip through OVS ODL class

OVS local IP is currently set through
puppet-tripleo's neutron ovs agent class.
Instead set it through ovs odl class.

Partial-Bug: #1789371
Depends-On: I5f6e8b76eeac75298f11d69441b9ad08a5c51005
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/597002/

Change-Id: Ia98f39c1185ff234d1d68737055cf3e6cb4a8bc4

commit_message:
Add pvremove to the disk clean step

wipefs is not enough to clean the disk and leave it unpartitioned for
heketi.

Co-Authored-by: Martin André <m.andre@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I70e7c3466fc01326c8c1610307e294a84ef61b9e

commit_message:
Remove roles blocking zuulv3 transition

RDO jobs need to be reparented off the base jobs
in tripleo-ci. To facilitate this, this review
removes roles that are not accessible from there.

Change-Id: I4954d89cf3eb21722022334e4a8cc152c54f1557
Closes-Bug: #1789294

commit_message:
Fluentd configures rsyslog to send logs properly

Fluentd configures rsyslog on the docker, but as the /etc/rsyslog.d directory
is not mounted, the rsyslog service is not configured.

This patch add the /etc/rsyslog.d directory to the fluentd container, so
rsyslog service is configured

Closes-Bug: #1780722
(cherry picked from commit d30adea380f37280308d71c44c9f94e2ba3b1b15)
Change-Id: Ie60757f1bfe919cca6b0290451ea059d762dcab8
